title: Write the basic structure of C programming
description: Just basic syntax of C

title: Print 'Hello, World!' to the screen.
description: Use printf() statements. use \n for new line

title: Print three lines of text one after another in the correct sequence (line 1 ➔ line 2 ➔ line 3).
description: Use three printf() statements in order. use \n

title: Print your name and age in two different printf statements.
description: Use printf() function twice.

title: Declare three (int, float, double) variables and print them.
description: Use printf() function.

title: Declare three (int, float, double) variables and modify their values then print them.
description: Use printf() function.

title: Declare 1 float & 1 double type variables and print them to three decimal places.
description: Use printf() function.

title: Take one integer input from the user and print it.
description: Use scanf() for input and printf() for output.

title: Take two integers input from the user and print their sum.
description: Use scanf() for input, + operator for sum, printf() to print.

title: Take two integers and print their difference (first minus second).
description: Use scanf(), - operator, and printf().

title: Take two numbers and print their product (multiplication).
description: Use scanf(), * operator, and printf().

title: Take two numbers and print their average.
description: Use scanf(), + and / operators, then printf().

title: Perform "100 + 200 / 10 – 3 * 10"  &  "(100 + 200) / 10 – 3 * 10" in printf function
description: Operator Precedence and Associativity

title: Input a floating point number (like 3.14) and print it.
description: Use scanf("%f", &variable) for input and printf() to print.

title: Take two floating point numbers and print their sum.
description: Use scanf("%f", &var) for floats, + operator, and printf().

title: Take an integer input and print its double.
description: Use scanf(), multiply by 2 (* operator), then printf().

title: Take an integer input and print its square (number × number).
description: Use scanf(), multiply number by itself, then printf().

title: Input two numbers, then swap their values (using a third variable).
description: Use scanf(), & third variable

title: Input two numbers, then swap their values (without using a third variable).
description: Use scanf(), & most importantly + and - operation for swap, then printf().

title: Input a character and print it back.
description: Use scanf("%c", &variable) and printf("%c", variable).

title: Input a character, then print the next character (example: input 'a' ➔ output 'b').
description: Use scanf(), add 1 to character, then printf().

title: Input a number and check if it is positive.
description: Use if condition with > 0.

title: Input a number and check if it is negative.
description: Use if condition with < 0.

title: Input a number and check if it is zero or not.
description: Use if-else condition to compare with 0.

title: Input two numbers and print which one is greater.
description: Use if-else with > operator.

title: Input two numbers and print which one is smaller.
description: Use if-else with < operator.

title: Input three numbers and find the largest.
description: Use nested if-else conditions.

title: Input a number and check if it is even or odd.
description: Use % 2 and if-else.

title: Input an age and check if eligible to vote (age ≥ 18).
description: Use if-else with >= operator.

title: Input a character and check if it is a vowel or consonant.
description: Use multiple if checks (a, e, i, o, u).

title: Input a temperature and check if it is hot (temp > 30).
description: Use if condition.

title: Input a temperature and check if it is cold (temp < 15).
description: Use if condition.

title: Input a number and check if it is a multiple of 10.
description: Use % 10 == 0 in if-else.

title: Input a year and check if it is a leap year.
description: Use divisible rules with %, if-else.

title: Input two numbers and check if they are equal.
description: Use == in if-else.

title: Input a number and check if it is divisible by 5.
description: Use % 5 == 0 check with if-else.

title: Input a number and check if it is divisible by both 3 and 5.
Input marks and print Pass if marks ≥ 40, otherwise Fail.
description: Use if-else with >= 40.

title: Input an integer and check if it is a single, double, or triple-digit number.
description: Use if-else chain with <10, <100, etc.

title: Input a score and grade it: A if ≥80, B if ≥60, C if ≥40, Fail otherwise.
description: Use multiple if-else if conditions.

title: Input a number and print if it is positive, negative, or zero.
description: Use if-else if conditions.

title: Print "Hello" 5 times.
description: Use for loop or while loop.

title: Print numbers from 1 to 10.
description: Use for loop.

title: Print numbers from 10 to 1.
description: Use for loop (counting backward).

title: Print even numbers from 2 to 20.
description: Use for loop with step 2 (i = i + 2).

title: Print odd numbers from 1 to 19.
description: Use for loop with step 2 starting from 1.

title: Print even numbers from 0 to 20.
description: Use for loop with step 2 (i = i + 2).

title: Print odd numbers from 0 to 20.
description: Use for loop with step 2 starting from 1.

title: Print numbers from 1 to N (input by user).
description: Use scanf() and for loop.

title: Print squares of numbers from 1 to 5.
description: Use for loop and i*i.

title: Print cubes of numbers from 1 to 5.
description: Use for loop and i*i*i.

title: Print all numbers from N to 1 (N input by user).
description: Use scanf() and for loop (reverse).

title: Print a multiplication table of 5.
description: Use for loop (5*i) from 1 to 10.

title: Input 2 numbers (a, b) & print them from a to b.
description: Use scanf() and for loop (forward).

title: Input 2 numbers (a, b) & print them from b to a.
description: Use scanf() and for loop (reverse).

title: Input 3 numbers (a, b, c) & print them from b to a & use c for interval.
description: Use scanf() and for loop (reverse).

title: Print numbers from 1 to 50 that are even.
description: Use for loop and if (i % 2 == 0).

title: Print numbers from 1 to 50 that are odd.
description: Use for loop and if (i % 2 != 0).

title: Print numbers from 1 to 100 divisible by 5.
description: Use for loop and if (i % 5 == 0).

title: Print numbers from 1 to 100 divisible by 3 and 5.
description: Use for loop and if (i % 3 == 0 && i % 5 == 0).

title: Print numbers between 1 to 100 which are multiples of 7.
description: Use for loop and if (i % 7 == 0).

title: Print numbers from 1 to 100 that are NOT divisible by 5.
description: Use for loop and if (i % 5 != 0).

title: Print numbers from 1 to 30 and print "Even" or "Odd" beside each.
description: Use for loop with if-else.

title: Print all numbers from 1 to 100 and stop if number is 50.
description: Use for loop and if (i == 50) break;.

title: Print numbers from 1 to 100 and skip multiples of 10.
description: Use for loop and if (i % 10 == 0) continue;.

title: Input a number N and print all divisors of N.
description: Use for loop and if (N % i == 0).

title: Print only prime numbers between 1 and 20.
description: Use nested for loop with simple prime check.

title: Print sum of only even numbers between 1 to N.
description: Use for loop and if (i % 2 == 0) sum += i;

title: Print sum of only odd numbers between 1 to N.
description: Use for loop and if (i % 2 != 0) sum += i;

title: Print factorial of a number N.
description: Use for loop to multiply (fact *= i).

title: Print numbers between 1 to 100 that are divisible by 2 or 3.
description: Use for loop with `if (i % 2 == 0

title: Print numbers from 1 to N, but only print when i*i < 100.
description: Use for loop and if (i*i < 100) printf().

title: Print numbers from N down to 1 and print only odd numbers.
description: Use for loop and if (i % 2 != 0).

title: Print all numbers between 1 to 100 that are divisible by 6 but not by 9.
description: Use for loop and if (i % 6 == 0 && i % 9 != 0).

title: Print "Fizz" for multiples of 3, "Buzz" for multiples of 5, and "FizzBuzz" for both.
description: Use for loop with multiple if-else checks.

title: Input a number N, print all numbers between 1 and N that are perfect squares.
description: Use for loop and if (i*i <= N).

title: Print a 3×3 matrix (only numbers from 1 to 9).
description: Use double for loops.

title: Print a 4×4 grid of stars (*).
description: Use double for loops with printf("*").

title: Print numbers in a triangle shape (1, 12, 123, etc.).
description: Use nested for loops.

title: Print a multiplication table from 1 to 5 (rows and columns).
description: Use double for loops to multiply and print.

title: Print a square pattern of numbers where each row has same number.
description: Use double for loops (row decides number).

title: Print a square pattern of numbers where each row has the same number & print the sum of each row
description: Use double for loops (row decides number) with each row sum

title: Print (A-Z) & (a-z) using Loop
description: Use for loops & ASCII Values

title: Print a pyramid pattern of stars (*).
description: Use triple for loops (spaces + stars + newline).

title:
Print the pattern of numbers like below:
1
2 3
4 5 6
description: Use double for loops and a counter variable.

title: Create a table showing sum of row and column numbers (3×3 grid).
description: Use double for loops (print row+col).

title: Print numbers from 1 to 100 but stop printing when number reaches 50.
description: Use for loop with if (i == 50) break;.

title: Print numbers from 1 to 30, skip multiples of 5.
description: Use for loop with if (i % 5 == 0) continue;.

title: Input numbers continuously, stop if user enters 0.
description: Use while loop with if (num == 0) break;.

title: Print numbers from 1 to 20, skip even numbers.
description: Use for loop with if (i % 2 == 0) continue;.

title: Print numbers 1 to 50, but stop if a multiple of 7 is found.
description: Use for loop with if (i % 7 == 0) break;.

title: Declare an array of 5 integers and input values.
description: Use array declaration and for loop with scanf().

title: Print all elements of an array.
description: Use for loop and printf().

title: Input 5 numbers and print the sum of the array elements.
description: Use array, for loop, and add all elements.

title: Input 5 numbers and find the maximum element.
description: Use array, for loop, and compare with a max variable.

title: Input 5 numbers and find the minimum element.
description: Use array, for loop, and compare with a min variable.

title: Input 5 numbers and search for a specific number.
description: Use for loop with if (array[i] == search_value).

title: Input n numbers and print only the even numbers.
description: Use for loop with if (array[i] % 2 == 0).

title: Input n numbers and print only the odd numbers.
description: Use for loop with if (array[i] % 2 != 0).

title: Reverse and print the array elements.
description: Use for loop from last index to 0.

title: Input n numbers and calculate the average of array elements.
description: Use for loop to sum, divide by 5, and printf().

title: Declare a 3×3 integer matrix and input all elements.
description: Use nested for loops with scanf().

title: Print a 3×3 matrix row by row.
description: Use nested for loops with printf().

title: Input a 2×2 matrix and print the sum of all elements.
description: Use nested for loops to add all elements.

title: Input a 2×2 matrix and print the largest element.
description: Use nested for loops and a max variable.

title: Input a 3×3 matrix and print elements of the main diagonal.
description: Use nested for loops where i == j.

title: Input a 3×3 matrix and print elements of the secondary diagonal.
description: Use nested for loops where i + j == size - 1.

title: Input two 2×2 matrices and print their sum matrix.
description: Use nested for loops to add corresponding elements.

title: Input a 2×3 matrix and print transpose of the matrix.
description: Use nested for loops (transpose[i][j] = original[j][i]).

title: Input a 3×3 matrix and count how many even numbers are there.
description: Use nested for loops with if (element % 2 == 0).

title: Input a 3×3 matrix and print the sum of each row separately.
description: Use nested for loops and sum rows inside inner loop.

title: Print 'Hello, World!' to the screen.
description: Use printf() to display the message.

title: Print your name and age in two different print statements.
description: Use scanf() to input name and age, then use two printf() statements.

title: Take two strings as input and concatenate them.
description: Use scanf() to input two strings and strcat() to join them.

title: Take a string input and find its length.
description: Use scanf() for input and strlen() to find and print the length.

title: Check if a string is empty.
description: Use strlen() to check if the string length is 0.

title: Convert a string to uppercase.
description: Use a loop to convert each character to uppercase using toupper().

title: Convert a string to lowercase.
description: Use a loop to convert each character to lowercase using tolower().

title: Find the first occurrence of a character in a string.
description: Use scanf() to input a string and a character, then use strchr() to find it.

title: Reverse a string.
description: Take a string input and print its reverse using a loop without built-in functions.

title: Count the number of vowels in a string.
description: Use a loop to check and count vowels (a, e, i, o, u) in the string.

title: Remove spaces from a string.
description: Use a loop to skip spaces and shift characters in the string.

title: Check if a string is a palindrome.
description: Compare characters from start and end to check for palindrome property.

title: Find a substring within a string.
description: Use strstr() to check if one string is a substring of another.

title: Count the number of occurrences of a character in a string.
description: Use a loop to count how many times the character appears.

title: Find the longest word in a sentence.
description: Split the sentence by spaces and compare word lengths to find the longest.

title: Compare two strings lexicographically.
description: Use strcmp() to compare and determine the order of two strings.

title: Replace a character in a string.
description: Use a loop to find and replace all occurrences of a given character.

title: Remove all non-alphanumeric characters from a string.
description: Use a loop and isalnum() to keep only alphanumeric characters.

title: Find the frequency of each character in a string.
description: Use an array or map to count and display frequency of each character.

title: Check if a string is empty.
description: Use strlen() or compare the string to "" to check if it's empty.

title: Check if a string contains a specific character.
description: Use strchr() to search for a character in a string.

title: Write a function to add two integers and return the sum.
description: Define a function with two parameters and return their sum.

title: Write a function to check if a number is even or odd.
description: Define a function that uses % 2 to check if a number is even or odd and returns the result.

title: Write a function to find the maximum of two numbers.
description: Define a function with two parameters and use if-else to return the greater number.

title: Write a function to calculate the factorial of a number (using loop).
description: Define a function that uses a for loop to calculate the factorial of a given number.

title: Write a function to check if a number is prime.
description: Create a function that takes an integer and returns whether it is a prime number or not.

title: Write a function to calculate the power of a number.
description: Create a function that takes base and exponent as parameters and returns base raised to the power of exponent.

title: Write a function to reverse a string.
description: Create a function that takes a string and returns its reverse.

title: Write a function to count the number of vowels in a string.
description: Create a function that takes a string and returns the count of vowels (a, e, i, o, u).

title: Write a recursive function to calculate factorial.
description: Use recursion: n * factorial(n - 1) with base case for n == 0 or 1.

title: Write a recursive function to print numbers from 1 to N.
description: Use a base case and recursive call to print numbers from 1 to N.

title: Write a recursive function to find the sum of the first n natural numbers.
description: Use recursion: sum(n) = n + sum(n - 1) with base case for n == 0.

title: Write a recursive function to reverse a string.
description: Use recursion to print or build the reverse of a string character by character.

title: Write a recursive function to check if a given string is a palindrome.
description: Compare first and last characters, then recursively check the substring in between.

title: Write a recursive function to find the sum of digits of a number.
description: Use recursion: sum = n % 10 + sum(n / 10) with base case for n == 0.

title: Write a recursive function to find the greatest common divisor (GCD) of two integers a and b.
description: Use Euclidean algorithm: GCD(a, b) = GCD(b, a % b) with base case b == 0.

title: Write a recursive function to generate all permutations of a string.
description: Use backtracking with recursion to swap characters and generate all permutations.

title: Write a recursive function to solve the Tower of Hanoi problem for N disks.
description: Use recursion to move disks between pegs following Tower of Hanoi rules.

title: Write a recursive function to perform binary search on a sorted array.
description: Use recursion to divide the search range and locate the target element.
